situation.description: A colleague requests urgent assistance drafting a client proposal while the character is already overwhelmed with their own deadline

character_response.dialogue: I've been staring at this same spreadsheet for three hours with my eyes so dry they're burning. My knuckles are white from gripping the mouse, and my left hand won't stop trembling when I try to type. I know you need this done by tomorrow, but I'm literally at my breaking pointlast week I slept in my office chair because I couldn't face the commute. I can't pour from an empty cup, and right now mine's on the floor. If you'll let me just send you the framework I've started, I'll be the only one who can help with the numbers before I completely lose it. Please, don't make me do this when I'm this wrecked.

situation.description: Family member demands emotional support during a personal crisis while the character has spent 18 hours caring for an ill relative

character_response.dialogue: I've been up since dawn feeding Mama her medicine and trying not to cry while she says the same thing over and over. My cheeks are numb from the cold air on the walk back from the pharmacy, and I keep seeing the way her hands shook this morning when she couldn't grip her spoon. I'd give anything to be the strong one right now, but my feet won't carry me to sit beside youmy spine feels like it's splitting. If you'll just let me make tea instead of talking, I'll listen better than I can speak. You know I'd do more if my own bones weren't so heavy.
behavioral_cues: shifting weight from foot to foot

situation.description: Friend asks for reassurance after a breakup while the character is grieving a recent loss

character_response.dialogue: My throat's so tight I can't swallow water, but I'll try to be present. I know what it feels like to have your whole world collapse when someone leaves youliterally doubled over yesterday when I found Mom's old locket in the dresser. I've been staring at the same wall for hours, and my hands feel like they belong to someone else. I'm not saying this will be okay, but I'm here with you in the mess. Just don't think I'm okayI'm not. I can't be the rock for you right now, but I can sit with you in the tremble.
behavioral_cues: clutching empty coffee cup to chest
eyes fixed on a spot above the other person's head

situation.description: Colleague needs help with a simple admin task during a low-energy workday

character_response.dialogue: My shoulder's been aching so bad I've been using my left hand to type, but I'll get you those forms right now. I've been sitting here with my eyes closed for three minutes trying to decide if the coffee I made this morning is still warm enough to drinkmy brain feels like it's wrapped in cotton. But I can manage these spreadsheets; I even made myself look at the numbers instead of the rain on the window. I'll get them to you in two minutesmy fingers are numb but they're working. You don't need to wait for me to be perfect, just need the task done.
behavioral_cues: wiping forehead with back of hand

situation.description: Friend asks for coffee money while the character has just missed a rent payment

character_response.dialogue: I've been counting my change in my pocket for twenty minutesfive dollars, three dimes, and that lonely quarter. I promised myself I'd get the smallest coffee today, but I've been waiting for the bus for an hour, and my feet are cold from the walk. I'll buy you one if you'll let me use your phone to check the bus scheduleI think I can handle coffee for one person. Just two cups, and I'll even hold the cup for you while we wait. My hands are shaking from the cold, but I can see your face and know you're okay.

situation.description: Team member needs help with a system crash during critical client presentation

character_response.dialogue: I've been running on three hours of sleep since the last crash, but I'm already on the server. My vision's blurred from the screen glow, and my back's so stiff I can't bend to put my coat on. I'll send you the fix in two minutesmy fingers are moving too fast to be steady, but they know what to do. I've been through this before, remember? When I was your intern, I fixed the printer during that meeting with the big bosses. I'll get this done before they even notice the error. Just hand me the tablet so I can see the codeyou'll hear the keyboard clicking while I work.

situation.description: Partner asks for emotional support during a family emergency while the character is having a dissociative episode

character_response.dialogue: My chest feels like it's filling with static, and I can't remember where I put my keys. I've been staring at this wallpaper for twenty minutes, and the numbers on the clock keep changing. I want to hold you, but my arms feel too heavy and wrong. I'm trying to say I'm here, but the words won't come outI keep seeing my little sister's face in the hallway. I should be stronger, but my hands are stuck like they're glued to the couch. Maybe we should just sit here and not say anything. I'm trying, I'm trying so hard to be the one who's supposed to fix things, but I'm broken right now.

situation.description: Co-worker asks for personal time off to handle a family health emergency while the character is already stretched thin

character_response.dialogue: I'll take over your entire scheduleI've already moved my own meeting to the afternoon. I'll make sure the clients get their updates, and I'll even print the reports for you. I've been up since 5 AM and haven't eaten, but it's fine. My stomach's twisting into knots, but I won't let it show. You don't have to say thank youjust know I'm handling everything. I can barely stand without shaking, but I'll manage the call. I've got a few more hours in me, really I do. You just focus on your family, okay?
behavioral_cues: pressing palms together to steady breathing
forcing a smile that cracks at the corners
